required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Effectiveness of Montelukast Versus Intranasal Fluticasone Propionate in the Management of Allergic Rhinitis Among Children 02 to 05 Years of Age
clinical_study.official_title: Effectiveness of Montelukast Versus Intranasal Fluticasone Propionate in the Management of Allergic Rhinitis Among Children 02 to 05 Years of Age

brief_summary.textblock: To determine the Effectiveness of Montelukast Versus Intranasal Fluticasone Propionate in the Management of Allergic Rhinitis Among Children 02 to 05 Years of Age.

detailed_description.textblock: Our study will compare the Effectiveness of Montelukast Versus Intranasal Fluticasone Propionate in the Management of Allergic Rhinitis Among Children 02 to 05 Years of Age as in our population compliance with oral medication is better among patients, and is socially and culturally more acceptable.

primary_outcome.measure: Improvement in Day and Night time nasal symptoms score of Allergic Rhinitis
primary_outcome.description: Effectiveness will be assessed by noticing the Improvement in Day and Night time nasal symptoms score of Allergic Rhinitis.

arm_group.description: Intranasal Fluticasone Propionate 50mcg/actuation in each nostril 24 hourly

intervention.intervention_name: Effectiveness of Montelukast Versus Intranasal Fluticasone Propionate in the Management of Allergic Rhinitis Among Children 02 to 05 Years of Age
intervention.description: Effectiveness of Montelukast Versus Intranasal Fluticasone Propionate in the Management of Allergic Rhinitis Among Children 02 to 05 Years of Age

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age:02 to 05 Years of Age
- both genders will be included.
- patients diagnosed with allergic rhinitis.
Exclusion Criteria:
- patients older than 05 years of age
- a positive history of HIV,TB,Immune deficiency.
- any nasal structural abnormality i.e.polyps,deviated nasal septum.
- history of frequent nasal bleeding,epistaxis.
- concomitant asthma.

overall_official.affiliation: Chairman/Head of Department of pediatrics unit 1 K.E. Medical University/Mayo hospital lahore

facility.name: King Edward Medical University/Mayo hospital lahore,punjab,pakistan 54000
